Event:
Feeling lonely and rejected by others.

The main event in this passage is the narrator's feeling of loneliness and rejection. They mention that they don't have any close friends and feel like they're constantly being rejected by those around them, including their ex-bridesmaid, a friend who guilted them into letting her stay at their place, and even their own mother, who has replaced them with their nephew. The narrator expresses a desire for someone to like them and be their friend, but feels like they're not meant to have any friends. They also mention feeling unhappy and crying in the bathroom, indicating the depth of their emotional distress.
Post: "Feeling so lost and alone, like no one wants me around. It's like I'm constantly being rejected, even by those I thought were my friends. My ex-bridesmaid uninvited me to her wedding, a 'friend' guilted me into letting her stay at my place, and even my own mother replaced me with my nephew. I just want someone to like me and be my friend, but it feels like I'm not meant to have any. *sniffs* Crying in the bathroom again..."

I'm terrified of what the future holds and fear that these thoughts will only intensify. Sometimes I even find myself plotting self-harm as a way to escape this never-ending torment."
